description: This image captures a solitary penguin waddling along a sandy beach, with the ocean waves gently lapping at the shore behind it. The penguin, likely a species adapted to coastal environments, is pictured in mid-stride, showcasing its unique gait and the distinctive black and white plumage that penguins are known for. The setting suggests a peaceful, natural habitat, possibly during a quiet moment of the day.
poem:
There once was a penguin at sea,
Who danced on the sand so free,
With a flip and a flap,
He closed up the gap,
And waddled as happy as can be.
